name: Architecture Governance Enforcement Symphony
title: Symphonia Architecture Governance Enforcement
description: Multi-movement orchestration that enforces JSON as single source of truth through systematic validation, implementation verification, and auditability across the entire Symphonia system.
purpose: Ensure that JSON definitions drive all changes: code must conform, tests must validate, and markdown must be derived. Every change flows through explicit governance beats with full traceability.
trigger: On every commit via pre-commit hook; on every PR via CI/CD; on-demand via `npm run governance:enforce`

policies: JSON is always the source of truth
Code changes must be preceded by JSON changes
Tests must verify JSON â†’ Code mapping
Markdown must be consistent with JSON
All handlers must be referenced by beats
All beats must have corresponding tests
All conflicts resolved in favor of JSON
metrics: Handler coverage (beats with handlers / total beats)
Test coverage (beats with tests / total beats)
Conformity score (JSON â†’ Code â†’ Tests â†’ Markdown)

movements.name: JSON Schema Validation
movements.description: Validate all JSON files against schema; ensure structure is correct and complete
movements.purpose: Establish JSON as authoritative by verifying it conforms to schema

beats.description: Load all symphony JSON files and validate against the canonical MusicalSequence schema where applicable, plus supporting JSON schemas
beats.scenario: Validate or Verify validate J S O N Schema Structure
acceptanceCriteria:
Given the validateJSONSchemaStructure operation is triggered
When the handler executes
Then it completes successfully within < 500ms
And the output is valid and meets schema
And any required events are published

Given valid input parameters
When validateJSONSchemaStructure processes them
Then results conform to expected schema
And no errors are thrown
And telemetry events are recorded with latency metrics

Given error conditions
When validateJSONSchemaStructure encounters an error
Then the error is logged with full context
And appropriate recovery is attempted
And the system remains stable

Given performance SLA of < 500ms
When validateJSONSchemaStructure executes
Then latency is consistently within target
And throughput meets baseline requirements
And resource usage stays within bounds

Given compliance and governance
When validateJSONSchemaStructure operates
Then all governance rules are enforced
And audit trails capture execution
And no compliance violations occur
beats.testCase: should detect incompatible major versions
beats.userStory: As an operations system, I want validateJSONSchemaStructure to execute reliably with latency < 500ms so that dependent services meet their SLA targets (goal: 99.9% success rate).
